Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); NEW KINGDOM ?; LATE PERIOD (not after)
Name: Lid fragment
Description: This fragment of the lid of a canopic jar, of which the provenance is not known, is made of terracotta. The facial features are slightly effaced, but the eyebrows, the nose and the chin are still well marked. The eyes are made from small balls of clay. The piece bears traces of several colours. The date is difficult to specify: the New Kingdom or even the Late Period.
